text:
I came across the usage of the volatile keyword in the file RunTime.java (runtime controller) where it is used as modifier for startTime.

Why is this used? The runtime controller should only be accessed from the thread where it is executed on.

Maybe there was a confusion with the transient keyword, as RunTime implements Serializable and this would be a member that needs not to be serialized.
creator: jens_0@hotmail.com

text:
No idea why it is there. Volatile was added in r325222 in Mar 2005.

I don't think the intent was to add transient.

I suspect volatile can just be removed.

If instances are used from multiple classes, then several other fields need synchronizing as well.
